sentence.Network_en: Not all the money, to put it mildly, has been used wisely.
sentence.Network_cn: 说得好听些，不是所有的钱都花得是地方。

sentence.Network_en: "I'm not meddling," Kenworthy said mildly, "I'm just curious."
sentence.Network_cn: “我不是在多管闲事，”肯沃西温和地说，“我只是好奇罢了。”

sentence.Network_en: To say we are disappointed about this is putting it mildly.
sentence.Network_cn: 说我们对此很失望是很客气的说法。

phrase.cizu_name: to put it mildly (或 putting it mildly)

jx.jx_en_mean: used to imply that the reality is more extreme, usually worse

lj.lj_ly: the proposals were, to put it mildly, unpopular.
lj.lj_ls: 客气点说，这些建议是不受欢迎的。

entry.tran: 说得委婉一些;说得轻一些
entry.def: You use to put it mildly to indicate that you are describing something in language that is much less strong, direct, or critical than what you really think.

example.ex: But not all the money, to put it mildly, has been used wisely...
example.tran: 但是说得委婉一些，并不是所有的钱都花得很明智。

example.ex: To say we are disappointed about this is putting it mildly.
example.tran: 说我们对此很失望是很客气的说法。

means.word_mean: 说得委婉些；说得好听一点

sentences.en: He was annoyed, to put it mildly (=he was very angry).
sentences.cn: 说得委婉些， 他有点恼火(他很生气)。

sentences.en: ‘She said you didn’t like it.’ ‘That’s putting it mildly—it’s hideous!’
sentences.cn: “她说你不太喜欢它。”“那是委婉的说法，我觉得这实在是丑恶之极！”
